result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jason A. Stickles was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $1,200 plus OWI costs.
Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation

records.addlTxt: Sentence hearing held 5/28/2015
Disbursements Journal Final

Defendant Jason A Stickles in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:13 a.m.  cases are called.
This is a sentencing hearing
13CF262, 13CF292, & 14CF340
Appearances stated on the record by ADA Constable.
The court received PSI, both counsel received as well.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Defense attorney makes corrections on the record
Prosecutor Constable argues regarding sentencing.
 Victim have been notified per ADA Constable.
Attorney McFarland for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant does not make a statement

BY THE COURT:
Cannot place on probation and cannot place in county jail.

13CF262
Ct 1 - a determinate sentence in prison system for 3 yrs, 6 mos.
Initial confinement is 1 year, 6 mos.
Extended Supervision is 2 years 
Credit for 52 days already served
Conditions of extended supervision 
--No contact with Crystal Lemke
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
--AODA and comply with the recommendations and any other treatment and programming as deemed appropriate by the agent
--sign a release for information form for offender assessment and other treatment
--pay costs
--obtain and maintain full time or combination thereof for employment or school
--provide a DNA sample, if not already done so
--costs to include DNA surcharge

Ct 2 - serve 90 days in jail concurrent with prison sentence
Pay costs

13CF292
Sentence is withheld
Probation for 1 year consecutive to period of extended supervision in 13CF262
Conditions - same as conditions of extended supervision
Pay costs

14CF340
Serve 180 days in county jail
Credit for 202 days already - confinement are satisfied.
Fine $1200.00 plus OWI costs
DL revoked for 4 years - Revocation is retroactive to the first date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation
IID on any vehicle owned, titled in his name or drives - 4 years effective today
Have a DOT assessment
All Bond money will be applied to the fine and costs

Court informs of right to appeal the sentence.  Court provides the determinate sentence form to the defendant.  

McFarland makes statement to the court re: bond.  

All Bond money will be applied to the fine and costs

Defendant remanded to sheriff to be transported to prison system.
10:52 a.m.  case is concluded.
Sentencing hearing at 05-28-2015 10:00 am

1:38 p.m. Defendant Jason A Stickles in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 13CF292, 13CF262, and 14CF340. ADA Constable requests hearing be rescheduled to allow time to review the PSI that was received late last Friday.  Atty McFarland concurs with the request.
Court reschedules cases.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jason A. Stickles in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Jason A. Stickles in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:33 a.m. case is called.  
13CF262, 13CF365, 14CF335,  and 14CF340
This is a bond modification motion hearing.
Attorney McFarland indicates he has been attending day reporting in Waupaca County in 14CF335 & 14CF340, states his position as to the cash bond amount and requests a wage assignment.  
Court reviews the bonds in the cases.  
Attorney McFarland makes additional statement in support of his position.  
ADA Constable indicates the Day Report was allowed in Waupaca County in 13CF262 on 1-13-14.
Court reviews the bond in that file (13CF262).
State responds to the motion and objects to the modification.  Defendant has outstanding OWI cases in Waupaca County as well as these Portage County matters.  
Court states there is confusion as to where he needs to report for Day Report as well as the 3rd OWI could be 4th due to the open cases in Waupaca County.  

BTC:  
The motion to modify the bond is denied.

10:47 a.m. Court is adjourned.
for Reduction of Bond
Motion hearing on November 3, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jason A. Stickles in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Jason A. Stickles in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing on 14CF340 and 14CF335.
